website_summaries.verdict: The Altra Paradigm 4.5 was considered a fantastic stability shoe by most of its wearers. The shoe was reviewed by the majority as having efficient support features and a comfortable fit. On the other hand, a few commenters had less than satisfying experiences because of issues in the shoe’s structural elements. Overall, the Altra Paradigm 4.5 was found by many as a shoe that effectively delivered its functions.
pros: Several runners were pleased with how the Altra Paradigm 4.5 helped relieve foot pain
Others specified that the shoe did not cause toe cramps like other running shoes
The Altra Paradigm 4.5 was also good for walking, according to some users
Various overpronators expressed their satisfaction with the supportive structure of the shoe
Many buyers agreed that the shoe was lightweight
A number of commenters appreciated the stretchable shoelaces of the Paradigm 4.5
cons: A user commented that the midsole lacked cushioning and did not absorb shock efficiently
Some wearers observed that the toe box was too stiff

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sneaker for Walking
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sneaker for comfort and walking. And in the black color it can also function as a dressier, but comfortable shoe. I like the altra brand sneakers for my daily speed walk. The sole is spongy, but firm so it provides great comfort and protection for your feet. The toe box style also provides more room and comfort for the toes. Altra makes a great sneaker, and that's why I have three pair in different colors.
customer_reviews.author: GREVIEWS

customer_reviews.title: Sole is too hard for running, Won't fit everybody, Narrower toebox, Overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Good: Appearance (more formal, Black color), comfort Bad: Much Narrower front part & toebox, not really 100% foot-shaped. Cheaper materials (sole is hard and not flexible like v3). Front edge has a low partly rigid protective material which prevents from lifting up your big toe. price Could be nice from Altra to make a wider toe-box version with a more flexible cushion in the picture: v3 size 12(46.5) vs v4.5 size 11 (I've used size 12 due to the sole width problem in altra shoes)
customer_reviews.author: Idan

customer_reviews.title: Larger than the v3.5, so exactly the size it should be!
customer_reviews.text: My last Paradigms were version 3.5, and they were sized maybe a half to full size too small. The photo I attached shows both shoes toed against the wall, and it's clear the v4.5 shoes are larger, which is good because the v3.5 shoes were too small for me. I kept hitting my toes. These are perfect. Will add to this review after I run in them for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: John B. Kalla

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth pair of Altra shoes. Previous shoes have all been fron the Lone peak line. These fit just a tiny bit bigger, but don't mind the extra wiggle room. Very comfortable out of the box, no break in period as was the case with the other Altras I have owned. Like the solid black color as I could get away using them at work, I work for UPS so comfort is a must.
customer_reviews.author: Raul B Sandoval

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Shoes fit great! Great shoe for longer runs, took them out for a 15miler, felt great right out of the box, had to retie them a few times to get the fit just right, but it is to be expected with a new shoe. The shoes don't feel mushy or overly soft, really well balanced for longer run.
customer_reviews.author: Etienne vlok

customer_reviews.title: Finally All Black!!
customer_reviews.text: I am a long time Altra wearer; in fact this may be my 7th or 8th pair. While they make them in dark colors, this is the first time I could find a hiking shoe in all black. I do hike in them, but more importantly now I can wear these to work and social functions without looking like I just have gym shoes on. These feel like you are walking on clouds. I'm thinking about buying another pair to hide in the closet for when these finally get too beat up. Hopefully Altra will continue to make some of their (hiking) shoes available in all black going forward.
customer_reviews.author: eb

customer_reviews.title: I love Altra!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 5th pair of Altra shoes and will not be my last. These are true to size unlike other Altra’s I own which ran small. Very comfortable and great for walking. These are perfect for those with PF! Soft yet stable, without Altra’s I’d be back at the podiatrist getting monthly injections for foot pain. These are life savers!
customer_reviews.author: Seeker77

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I had surgery for bilateral hallux rigidus in April. The surgery on the rt side was a resounding failure! I hav ent been able to hike since then. I did a lot of research, because I did NOT want a second surgery, and these shoes were highly rated for my condition. I started walking the other day and AMAZING...I could walk and hike. I still have some pain and incoordination because of the BAD surgery but I can now walk for an hour with minimal pain. HAPPY DANCE. UPDATE: I have now been walking agin for weeks with MINIMAL pain...I LOVE THESE SHOES
customer_reviews.author: ZZ Mop

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like them but couldn't
customer_reviews.text: I have lots of pairs of various Altra shoes - Instinct, Torin, Timp. This was the first time I tired the Paradigm. In theory the idea of a rail to help prevent over pronation sounds good, but I did not like the feel of the shoe when I put it on. It felt too narrow and restricting. I tried walking with them around my house for a couple of days, but decided to return them.
customer_reviews.author: mbarb54

customer_reviews.title: Not too swimmy BUT TOO TIGHT!  narrow sneaker
customer_reviews.text: Shoe advertised as quality sneaker with large toe box, foot shaped. Well, not even close. The sneaker is tight, even after loosening the laces and trying to get some foot room...NONE.. the heel rubs in the back, it is low and if I had walked/ran any distance at all I would have had heel bleeds on both sides. Toe Box seems big..but why did both pinky toes feel friction at all times. Just a poorly made 2019 Vietnamese pair of sneakers. Some complained they "swim" in it. NOT me, way too tight. Was I supposed to not wear socks.....?
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine Pasquale

customer_reviews.title: best running shoe brand
customer_reviews.text: Been using these as an allaround workout shoe. I've got wide feet and these shoes fit perfectly and provide unmatched cushioning and arch support. The altra brand toebox design is second to none.
customer_reviews.author: James M.

customer_reviews.title: Not the normal quality from Altra
customer_reviews.text: I wore these shoes once and noticed the sole on one was separating or hadn’t been glued entirely.
customer_reviews.author: America First

customer_reviews.title: Finally! My quest for a great shoe is over!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased twenty pairs of shoes in the last 3 1/2 years. This zero drop shoe with glove-like comfort put a spring into my step. The padded heel and metatarsal has eliminated the severe pain I was experiencing in my toes and the ball of my foot. I also have four different brands of insoles for PF that I am using in my other shoes. No need for insoles in the shoe... All that coupled with the stability feature has made this shoe my favorite walker (I am unable to run).. Thank you Altra!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Green

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: This is a good shoe for comfort and walking. The sole is spongy, but firm so it provides great comfort and protection for your feet, but I had some pain in metatarsal area.The toe box style also provides more room and comfort for the toes.
customer_reviews.author: ward

customer_reviews.title: ALTRA Paradigm- comfortable but Heel and sole wear out immediately
customer_reviews.text: SO... Im on my 3rd pair now and missed the window to return again. Its summer in AZ and I have been wearing lighter sneakers/ sandals ---I noticed this 3rd pair was coming apart after a couple days use. If I were you i would not buy this model ad the Sole/Heal starts to degrade almost on the first day wearing them. If i get around to it Ill ad a photo or 2.
customer_reviews.author: rocky

customer_reviews.title: Really comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for shoes that would assist with my healing of plantar fasciitis, and get me back to running. These are excellent in holding the foot in a natural state. Takes a little getting used to as it feels strange in the beginning. Once you get used to it it’s like walking on a cloud and will keep your feet smiling. I am now an Altra fan!
customer_reviews.author: Gemineye

customer_reviews.title: Feel great and love the style
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing Altra running shoes since January 2016. This version is what Altra recommended to replace my previous favorite Altra running shoe. I'm now used to the size so am not surprised the shoe fit as expected.
customer_reviews.author: david61821

customer_reviews.title: Great for flat feet and overpronation.
customer_reviews.text: Loved the shoe from the moment I put them on. I work in Radiology and pull 16 hour shifts,this is the first shoe I’ve ever had where my feet or knees didn’t hurt after a shift. Very comfortable and cushioned great. I’m 6ft 3 235lb with extremely flat feet and overpronate. I will definitely buy another pair. Thanks Altra! Update- since I ordered my first pair of Altras I ordered a second pair in gray! I can’t say enough about how comfortable these shoes are wide toe box and crazy comfortable for anyone that works long hours in healthcare.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Altra keeps getting it wrong
customer_reviews.text: About 5 years ago I bought my first pair of altras and fell in love with the company, i'm not sure whats happened but the last 4 pair of shoes i've bought from them have been horrible. I wanted to give these a few miles to break in and maybe I would like them but it never happened and now im just out $100. I suggest looking for another more consistent shoe until Altra gets it together.
customer_reviews.author: kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Great support
customer_reviews.text: Just got them, had my first 5K yesterday and I was very happy with the fit and feel. I love the wide fit. My feet felt great after the run. I needed the extra support of the shoe, I have the Torin and my ankles were swollen after every run. Not so with the Paradigm. Good ankle support and excellent cushioning.
customer_reviews.author: Michael '52

customer_reviews.title: Excellent model. Another hit from Altra.
customer_reviews.text: I've worn Altras for years. I wanted to stick with the Provision model but because of the new design rubbing a blister on the top of my foot I tried these. Wow. The difference in quality vs. the Provision is significant. I don't usually like max cushioning shoes, but these still have the Altra feel. I have really enjoyed these so far.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Vance

customer_reviews.title: Extremely comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I've looked for a long time for a pair of trainers that didn't try to make my toes cram into a point. These are the ones...not only do they have a wide toe box, but they are extremely cushy to walk on. Bought 2 pair.
customer_reviews.author: Whereupon

customer_reviews.title: Repeat buyer
customer_reviews.text: Last longer than a month like the $130 nikes I was buying. I spend 10 hrs a day on my feet. These are my 3rd pair.
customer_reviews.author: Cheese man

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: Love altra, large toe box heal doesn’t Slip. We’re while hiking the Appalachian trail and now wear them on 12 hour shifts at work walking on concrete. Wish they had a working model altra shoe.
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: great shoe for walking or running
customer_reviews.text: fit is good, heal and ball of foot cushioned well
customer_reviews.author: Richard E. Menendez

customer_reviews.title: Zero drop footbed!
customer_reviews.text: This shoe has a zero drop footbed which I did not know and cannot wear so had to return them without using them. I liked the style and wide toe box but can't use them.
customer_reviews.author: Dr.J

customer_reviews.title: Toebox too shallow for my feet.
customer_reviews.text: I love the wide toebox of Altra shoes, but this model didn't have a deep enough toebox for me. I am returning them.
customer_reviews.author: M Gulden

customer_reviews.title: Size on the newer version of ALTRA shoes runs small.  I had to order a full size up.
customer_reviews.text: Size on the newer version of ALTRA shoes runs small. My foot measures in at 9US . My last pair of ALTRA's, Provision 3.5, was half a size too small. Despite sizing up, to a 9.5, my toe still hit the end of the shoe and it was too narrow in the midfoot. This time I ordered a 10US and they fit perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Jiricek

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable with lots of cushioning and support.
customer_reviews.text: Simply order a full size up (example 11 > 12) and they’ll fit great. Very comfortable with lots of cushioning and support for all day wearing plus they hold your heel in nicely.
customer_reviews.author: MK+

customer_reviews.title: For wide foot
customer_reviews.text: The men's shoe fits like a Wide in women's and that's exactly what I need since I'm a female with wide feet. Wiggle room "where have you been all my life" toe box. The guard rail is a welcomed addition.
customer_reviews.author: Angie Lulu Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great Cushion for Achilles and Knees (and Wide Feet)
customer_reviews.text: All kinds of ligament issues with my Achilles and knees; these are great. I’ve been an ASICS guy forever but they stopped the high cushion for wide feet. Only have a couple weeks on them so far but I really love these shoes. I think Altra is my new brand.
customer_reviews.author: EBQ

customer_reviews.title: Wide toe box.
customer_reviews.text: Wide toe box and solid construction. Very happy. Good cushioning. I have dozens of shoes due to chronic foot pain. The wide toe box makes a huge difference.
customer_reviews.author: Serenity Now

customer_reviews.title: Great for stabilizing show.
customer_reviews.text: It was great to run with it for the first time. I will keep a close eye of how it will leave up to its expectation. I run 8 to 16 miles per week so we will see what will happen at the 50-mile mark.
customer_reviews.author: Dotan

customer_reviews.title: Paradigm Shift
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing Altra Paradigms for 6+ years. This one seems to have the least cushion (although it says 30mm) and the extra hole in the lace system is missing which hurts the heel slip situation. I'll give it a few more runs, but for the price, I would expect them to improve the shoe, not make it worse. This one is worse. Cooler, but worse.
customer_reviews.author: BHRlfy

customer_reviews.title: Altra is the new Nike.
customer_reviews.text: We knew we wanted these and ordered them. Arrives timely. Excellent shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Dye

customer_reviews.title: Just Ok
customer_reviews.text: All in all these are ok shoes. If you like a cushy/plush shoe with lots of room, and only pound the pavement, these guys are great. For some reason my feet are not a fan and As a trail shoe they are too sloppy. Way to easy to roll an ankle on uneven and slick surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Kanz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. Soles stiff at first but broke in quickly. Super comfortable, breathable, and cushy.
customer_reviews.author: W. Perkins

customer_reviews.title: No pain!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe which does not hurt your feet or your feelings. Buy it and you won’t regret. Wishing that it was cheaper!
customer_reviews.author: Krishna B. Lall

customer_reviews.title: Awesome comfortabler shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. I have physical foot problems that have caused me to try shoes after shoes in an effort to find some that provide some form of comfort. These shoes fit me perfectly, offer good support, and they are now all I wear. No toe pinching, no more aching feet, just awesome comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Doug G

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Road Shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair and they’re still my favorite road shoe. I have well over 600 walking miles on them. The uppers still look nice but the soles are definitely done! My only complaint is they’re over priced when sold at the regular retail price.
customer_reviews.author: P. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes if your feet hurt
customer_reviews.text: Super cushioned yet very stabile and supportive. I have foot problems and most other shoes make them hurt. I own 3 different pairs of Altras now and won’t wear anything else
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Best fit and comfort
customer_reviews.text: If you have flat feet these are the shoes for you, only bad thing Altra please remove lettering on stabil pods, they cut your ankle, that sucks, please remove for 5.0.
customer_reviews.author: K.H.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Use for walking. Have many foot issues-gout , P f and Morton’s neuroma. These shoes are best and are my 2nd pair, 1st were great also, Torin 2. These new ones are even more cushioned.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart Bunn

customer_reviews.title: Not For Normal Arch
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these shoes, but they are built for someone with a high arch. I tried them both running and just walking around but they rubbed my inner arch and cause a blister every time.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: most comfoetable shoes ever but, but the looks are so so
customer_reviews.author: Tim Sim

customer_reviews.title: Add a size
customer_reviews.text: First pair of altras had to go up a 1/2 size.
customer_reviews.author: SD

customer_reviews.title: Best
customer_reviews.text: Best shoe for me. Wide toe box and sooooo soft
customer_reviews.author: dennis rask

customer_reviews.title: Great running, hiking, biking sneakers
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, plenty of arch, great width around the ball resulting in total comfort. Love mine!
customer_reviews.author: Edwin Degenhart

customer_reviews.title: nike shox v. Altra Paradigm 4.5 running
customer_reviews.text: Be ready for the "drop effect" in the paradigm 4.5, you feel like your going to fall backward. Comfort wise is outstanding after yard work in boots. Feels like you don't have a shoes on your feet. I think it will just take some time to get used to the feel and fit after years wearing Nike Shoxs.
customer_reviews.author: richard

customer_reviews.title: Squishy but fast!
customer_reviews.text: I love Altra Paradigms. These new ones are built much better. The rubber soles are beefy and have held up much better than previous versions.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan knutson

customer_reviews.title: Good recovery Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable but in my case it was a little to big. Kept them anyways because of how comfortable they are.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel

customer_reviews.title: toe box is wide enough
customer_reviews.text: after trying a couple other Altra versions, this shoe is wide enough for the ball of my foot and toes to fit well. Had a previous pair of Altras and found some of the ones I tried to replace them were more narrow in the toe box. This version worked out.
customer_reviews.author: Ingrid S.

customer_reviews.title: Slips up and down
customer_reviews.text: Shoe slips up and down unless you have them laced really tight. My other Altra shoes, TIMP, don't do this.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Roach

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable cushioning but uppers need to be worked on.
customer_reviews.text: The Paradigm 4.5 are well cushioned and supportive shoes. The only negative experience is that the crease that forms on the uppers on top of my toes pinch my pinkie toes on both feet. If not for this, the shoes would have been perfect..
customer_reviews.author: OnlyPerfectShoes

customer_reviews.title: Best running shoe on the market
customer_reviews.text: If you like to run without pain, I suggest this shoe. It's easy on the feet and knees. All Altra shoes are the best if you're injury prone or old like me!
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe. Love them.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are so comfortable. I have a bunion and these shoes allow my toes to splay.
customer_reviews.author: Puromatic

customer_reviews.title: i prefer escalante 2
customer_reviews.text: They don't fit as snug as my escalante 2 altras. I bought these 'cause they're all black and I wanted to have a casual-wear altra. My feet don't like these as much as the escalantes
customer_reviews.author: alan

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe
customer_reviews.text: I would suggest that you order the shoe in a size 1/2 larger than you would normally wear. Like them other than being a bit snug on my left foot.
customer_reviews.author: torahsamurai

customer_reviews.title: I like them
customer_reviews.text: Basically my 2nd pair, the 1st one's just wouldn't die, fat guy walking.
customer_reviews.author: STEPHEN A ONEAL

customer_reviews.title: planters fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: I bought them to help my planters fasciitis. I did wonders the first day I wore them. No more tried aching feet! I would highly recommend them for planters fasciitis.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe to work in if you are on your feet all day.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie McMillin

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great product, I was having problems with my foot and the Doctor mentioned these shoes to me I brought a pair. Feel really great thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As promised
customer_reviews.text: Prompt delivery of a very comfortable and well designed product.
customer_reviews.author: R. A. Perez-Tamayo

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had the show for about a week and it seems to be what I needed. I have plantar fasciitis and appears to be helping somewhat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to use when I referee basketball. I've been refereeing for over 10 years, and these are by far the best shoe I've used refereeing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are lightweight, comfortable shoes for running, walking, or just wearing around town.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Kaufman

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, except the heel...
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t like how the heel fit on my foot...feels like it slips often even though the shoe is the right size.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew D. Cobb

customer_reviews.title: Order a 1/2 size larger and very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: No dislikes. I have flexibility in tightening. They are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: M. Finegold

customer_reviews.title: narrow mid foot compared to Torin
customer_reviews.text: Tried this after using Torin's for the past year. Very narrow and was not comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: Pleased to catch these great running shoes on sale, thanks!
customer_reviews.text: Even though Altra has moved on to marketing the latest version I like this one.
customer_reviews.author: Evets Lladnar

customer_reviews.title: Product is what was expected.
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are comfortable and feels like you are running on clouds.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: Smooth Ride
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe! hopefully shoe soles will last longer than other paradigms shoes
customer_reviews.author: Rico

customer_reviews.title: Aplus
customer_reviews.text: The Altra Paradigm 4.5 cured my planter fasciitis. Walking pain free again.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Altra has strayed from producing quality products.
customer_reviews.text: All of Altras new shoes do not have the same comfort and fit like their previous shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey s Forsse

customer_reviews.title: Great running and walking shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Altra's are the bomb - but, you have to catch them on sale. The Torin is a Great shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Beckett

customer_reviews.title: Perfect transaction
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe at a great price with super fast delivery!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like running on a cloud
customer_reviews.text: This shoe has taken my running to a new level. Sounds ridiculous, but they are perfect for my running routines, which are completely on asphalt and concrete- which is terrible for your entire body in all the other shoes I have tried. I just finished a personal best half-marathon in these babies, and I have zero doubts that their design, comfort, and light weight build made a huge difference. I'm an Altra fan from now on. This was actually my second pair of Altra's, but the Paradigm 4.5 does exactly the thing it advertises- it is for the hard surfaces!
customer_reviews.author: rcaseytx

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I am a nurse and on my feet all day long. These shoes have awesome support and I would recommend them to anyone that has a job requiring them to be standing/walking all day.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Inner lining quality - worse than other brands owned before (NIKE, ASICS, HOKA)
customer_reviews.text: I made an overall rating after purchase, and gave 5 stars a month ago. The shoe (outsole, foot size) still OK. But inner lining can be complained. Now after 130 km-s ran in the ALTRA PARADIGM 4.5 the inner lining in the back side and heel corner of the right shoe already started to get loose, also the sponge missing in 1 cm lenght. ...I can only hope that this was a rare sole pair of ALTRA PARADIGM 4.5's that had this quality issue... as compared to its price - and to other brands - this cannot be a level a runner would love to purchase. In my understanding this price range should not bear quality issues at all!
customer_reviews.author: GABOR N.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes & service
customer_reviews.text: Best running shoes I have used & sportsshoes.com service was brilliant
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, very durable
customer_reviews.text: I've just ordered my fourth pair of Paradigms. Great shoes. I get around 850 miles per pair, so they're good value. Comfortable for long runs. Best road shoes I've had.
customer_reviews.author: Chapman

product_meta.title: ALTRA Paradigm 4.5 Running Shoes - SS20
product_meta.description: Altra Paradigm 4.5 Running Shoes Delivering a stabilised ride with maximum cushioning, the Altra Paradigm 4.5 Running Shoes uses multiple technologies to keep your feet feeling happy no matter what distance you are covering. Engineered Knit Mesh Quick drying engineered knit mesh encases each foot in breathable comfort. The mesh allows air to fully permeate the entire upper, sucking in cool, fresh air while at the same time pushing out hot, muggy air. This system creates a microclimate within the shoes that allows you to feel comfortable throughout the run. Lightweight and breathable allows a more streamlined, comfortable run to reduce any unwanted bulk so you maintain focus. Furthermore, the knitted mesh features a much more closed knit providing structural integrity without the need for overlays that adds weight to the shoes. In addition, as you start to tire and fatigue kicks in during the longer runs, the Guiderail really starts to earn its place. The Guiderail works to keep your foot in the most natural position possible, preventing the early stages of overpronation. The footshape technology allows the toes to be relaxed and allows them to spread out naturally with the big toe remaining in a straight position for additional comfort, speed and stability. Lastly, a traditional lacing system adds familiarity and provides confidence to you, the wearer that you can rely on this system. The laces provide a nice snug and locked in fit which in turn prevents any in shoe slipping that can occur during high-intensity activities. Altra Ego Midsole The midsole unit uses Altra Ego which is a dual-nature midsole compound with a responsive, yet soft feel for increased energy return. the Dual-Layer EVA cushioning reduces the wear and tear placed on joints, lessening the potential risk of injury in susceptible areas. Secondly, the midsole features Altra's zero drop platform. Every Altra shoe features the Zero Drop Platform that places the heel and forefoot the same
feature_bullets: Breathable - Air can flow in and out of the shoe for ventilation.
Lightweight - Unwanted bulk and weight is removed from the shoe, keeping the overall feeling to lightweight.
Guiderail - This works to keep your feet in the most natural position possible, preventing overpronation.
Footshape Technology - Allows the forefoot to be more relaxed, allowing the toes to spread naturally.
Traditional Lacing System - Easy to achieve a secure close fit.
